The Facebook posts containing the claim: 2. The Malaysian-language caption of the Facebook posts translated to "How badly our forests have been flattened, after a tiger and a bear, this time it’s a panda found wandering among the residential area."
A comparison was made between the animal: showing that the animal in the photo was actually a tapir and not a panda.
Local media: specifically Utusan Online, reported on the incident using the same photo as seen in the Facebook post, but the title of the article referred to the animal as a tapir that got lost in a residential area.
